title: Fried Rice
detailed_instructions:
1. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
2. Add finely chopped garlic and sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.
3. Add diced onions, carrots, and peas, and stir-fry for 3–4 minutes until vegetables are tender.
4. Push the vegetables to one side and scramble 2 beaten eggs in the empty space.
5. Mix the scrambled eggs with the vegetables.
6. Add 3 cups of cooked rice and stir everything together.
7. Pour in 2 tablespoons of soy sauce, 1 tablespoon of oyster sauce, and 1 teaspoon of sesame oil.
8. Stir-fry for another 3–4 minutes until everything is well mixed and heated through.
9. Garnish with chopped green onions before serving.

title: Pasta Alfredo
detailed_instructions:
1. Boil water in a large pot, add salt and cook 200g of fettuccine pasta until al dente.
2. Drain and set aside, reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water.
3. In a pan, melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat.
4. Add 3 minced garlic cloves and sauté until aromatic.
5. Pour in 1 cup of heavy cream and bring it to a gentle simmer.
6. Stir in 3/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese and mix until smooth.
7. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
8. Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and toss to coat evenly.
9. Use reserved pasta water to loosen the sauce if needed.
10. Serve hot, garnished with parsley and more parmesan.

title: Chicken Curry
detailed_instructions:
1. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan over medium heat.
2. Add 1 chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
3. Stir in 1 tablespoon of ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
4. Add 1 chopped tomato and cook until soft.
5. Add 1/2 teaspoon turmeric, 1 teaspoon cumin, 1 teaspoon coriander, 1 teaspoon garam masala, and salt.
6. Cook the spices for a minute, then add 500g of chicken pieces.
7. Sear the chicken until lightly browned.
8. Pour in 1 cup of water or coconut milk and bring to a boil.
9. Cover and simmer for 20–25 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
10. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

title: Veggie Burger
detailed_instructions:
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. Sauté 1/2 chopped onion, 1 minced garlic clove, and 1 grated carrot until softened.
3. In a bowl, mash 1 cup of cooked chickpeas.
4. Add sautéed vegetables, 1/4 cup breadcrumbs, 1 tablespoon flour, salt, pepper, and your choice of spices.
5. Mix thoroughly and form into 2–3 patties.
6. Cook patties in a greased skillet for 3–4 minutes per side until golden brown.
7. Toast burger buns and assemble with lettuce, tomato slices, patties, and condiments like mayo or ketchup.
8. Serve warm with a side of fries or salad.

title: Paneer Tikka
detailed_instructions:
1. Cut 200g paneer into cubes and place in a bowl.
2. In a separate bowl, mix 1/2 cup yogurt, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 teaspoon turmeric, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 1 teaspoon red chili powder, and salt.
3. Add 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste to the mixture.
4. Coat paneer cubes in the marinade and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
5. Thread marinated paneer, bell peppers, and onions onto skewers.
6. Grill or bake at 200°C (390°F) for 15–20 minutes until charred.
7. Baste with butter or oil halfway through cooking.
8. Serve hot with mint chutney and lemon wedges.
